オプション1:
"I've gathered four coconuts.
With these, it should do until I bring the children."
"Th-thank you... You saved me."
The man smiled, but his face throughout was one of enduring pain.
(That looks painful...)

"They attacked me and I tumbled down the slope.
You saw them, right? Those weird ones."

"Yeah. Those... the ones swarming outside—what are those monsters?
I've never heard of anything like that."

"I don't know either... You see how densely packed they are?
I think that's not normal."
"Didn't we learn back in school how much grassland one zebra needs?"
"Maybe we did..."

"If animals that big existed at that density,
this island would be a desert and they'd have gone extinct."

"Maybe they're not creatures of this world.
They don't eat anything, do they?"

(They had smell and a fresh, lifelike look,
but their movement was like a remote‑control toy.)
Star Man remembered the children.

"Actually, I'm having two children wait in the mountains...
May I bring them here?"
"Uh... well..."
"We'll use a room away from here. Please."
"... Uh, hmm... if that's the case... I guess it's fine."
"All right, I'll go get them. I'm Star Man."
"O-okay. I'm Trapezoid Man. There's something else on this island besides those monsters. Be careful."
"Yeah. Thanks."
After eating, Star Man set out toward the children.
